duties_responsibilities.duty: Operate various equipment related to hop processing, including tanks, agitators, pumps, valves, filtration equipment, and heat exchangers.
Control and monitor multiple processes covered by OSHA’s Process Safety Management Standards.
Participate in Process Safety Management (PSM) as an individual contributor.
Perform preventative and predictive maintenance on mechanical equipment.
Provide breakdown support and troubleshooting for equipment as needed.
Responsible for maintaining good GMP practices, plant sanitation, and facilities maintenance.
Perform warehouse material handling functions, including forklift operation and loading and unloading of materials.
Package advanced hop products into standard containers, including filling, sealing, labeling, palletizing, and handling of product.
Provide support and monitoring of utility-related equipment, including boilers, compressors, water softeners, etc.
Provide support and monitoring of other relevant equipment as needed.

education_certification.credential: Technical background (through an apprenticeship or an associate degree program) and experience in an operations role, preferably in a food or beverage industry or other similar facilities.
Experience in a maintenance-based role, manufacturing environment, and the food and beverage industry is preferred.
